laboratory_examinations.findings: Normal background and generalized high-voltage bursts of spike-wave and polyspike discharges at a rate of 3 per second. Discharges more prominent with hyperventilation and photic stimulation.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: During the next EEG study, bursts of high-amplitude 3-Hz delta were observed, but the spike component had largely disappeared. The EEG two years later showed slowing of the background posterior dominant rhythm, high-amplitude bursts of delta slowing every 5 to 15 seconds, and both unilateral and bilateral epileptiform spike discharges.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Mild cerebral and cerebellar atrophy and mild periventricular hyperintensities.
No evidence of lysosomal storage disease.
